business.headline: Work-life imbalance? Karnataka plans 12-hour days for tech sectorAt present, Section 7 of the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, 1961, limits working hours to nine per day, and allows a maximum of 10 hours of overtime in three months.

Your savings account is quietly robbing you, says financial advisorFinancial advisor Lovish Anand has issued a sharp reality check for Indian savers in a recent LinkedIn post titled: "Your Savings Account Is Quietly Robbing You."

Insured, but at what cost?Hospitals are turning into battlegrounds over pending claims, with policyholders watching their premiums shoot up faster than their salaries. Insurance is no longer the comforting shield it once was.

Is Rs 70 lakh per annum the new middle class? Investment banker explainsAre urban professionals struggling even with Rs 70 lakh income per year? A Gurugram-based investment banker breaks down where the money really goes.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 24,800; Tech Mahindra shares down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 225.26 points to 81,219.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.75 points to 24,755.30 as of 9:21 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today over US Fed rate cut news?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,782 as of 8:23 am, which suggests that Nifty50 might open below Tuesday's closing level of 24,812.05.
Microsoft to cut thousands of jobs in sales: ReportThe latest round of layoffs follows Microsoft's earlier job cuts in May, which impacted around 6,000 workers across various departments.

Stocks to watch June 19: HDFC Bank, Jio Financial, Hero, Abott, Tata ElxsiWith the US Federal Reserve deciding to keep its key lending rate unchanged, traders and investors in India may react cautiously in today's session.

Air India cuts 15% of international ops till mid-July citing checks, global unrestAir India has temporarily cut 15% of its international widebody flights until mid-July due to Middle East tensions, airspace curfews in Europe and East Asia, and increased safety measures following recent disruptions. This comes after the June 12 Ahmedabad plane crash.

Dassault, Reliance Infrastructure to make Falcon 2000 business jets in IndiaDassault said it aims to deliver the first made-in-India jets by 2028 for corporate and military use, and will cater to rising demand in both Indian and international markets.
Sensex ends 138 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Titan down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 138.64 points to close at 81,444.66, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 41.35 points to end at 24,812.05.

IPO market heats up with Rs 26,000 crore fundraising in JuneA resurgence in initial public offerings is evident as several major companies plan to launch IPOs in June and July, raising substantial funds.

entertainment.headline: Zeenat Aman recalls her schoolgirl crush on Shashi Kapoor and that first kissActor Zeenat Aman shared her fond memories with 'Satyam Shivam Sundaram' co-actor Shashi Kapoor. From having a schoolgirl crush to sharing their first on-screen kiss, Aman praised Kapoor's warm persona and artistic legacy.

Sachin Tendulkar reviews Aamir Khan's Sitaare Zameen Par with a big thumbs up. WatchCricketer Sachin Tendulkar watched Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' and couldn't stop raving about the power of the film. The actor shared a video in which Tendulkar could be seen giving a thumbs up to the film's team.

Neena Gupta says romance is about feeling good, not just sexVeteran actor Neena Gupta shares her thoughts on love beyond 50 and meaningful roles. She emphasises romance as feeling good rather than just physical attraction, highlighting her fearless career choices.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday's tanned looks from Tu Meri Main... sets go viralKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday are currently shooting for 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' in Croatia. As fans anticipate the film's release, pictures of the two from the sets have gone viral.

Meet Sekhar Kammula, Telugu director who became a star without chasing starsAt a time when Telugu cinema is increasingly leaning on star power and spectacle, director Sekhar Kammula stands out for his quiet conviction. For over 25 years, he has consistently chosen stories over scale, characters over celebrity, and conviction over compromise, making him one of the industry's unique and respected voices.

Priyanka Chopra, Malti have a blast at Disney World with Mickey Mouse and thrill ridesPriyanka Chopra took her daughter Malti Marie on a fun-filled trip to Disney World, where Malti enjoyed her very first roller coaster ride. The duo rode it four times, and the adorable moments quickly went viral online.

Junaid Khan-Sai Pallavi's Ek Din teaser to be attached with Sitaare Zameen ParJunaid Khan teams up with Sai Pallavi for a romantic drama titled 'Ek Din'. The film's teaser will be unveiled in theatres alongside Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on June 20, 2025.

Mammootty suffering from minor complication, undergoing treatment: Kerala leaderMalayalam superstar Mammootty is suffering from a minor health complication, said Kerala politician John Brittas. He further added that the actor is undergoing treatment for the same.

FIR against Kesari Chapter 2, Trinamool says film insults Bengal's freedom struggleAkshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' landed into controversy after Trinamool Congress criticised the film for allegedly distorting Bengal's freedom struggle and misrepresenting key revolutionaries.

Sitaare Zameen Par advance booking: Aamir Khan's film to beat Laal Singh Chaddha Sitaare Zameen Par is performing well in its advance booking at the box office. The Aamir Khan film is all set to surpass his 'Laal Singh Chaddha' on its opening day, it seems.

Kaalidhar Laapata: Abhishek Bachchan announces his next, to release on OTT in JulyAbhishek Bachchan has finally put an end to all the teasing with an announcement of his next film. Titled 'Kaalidhar Laapata', the film will release on OTT in July.

Ajay Devgn returns with Son of Sardaar 2, announces release dateAjay Devgn wears the turban again as he brings the sequel to his 2012 hit action comedy - 'Son of Sardaar 2'. The film also features Mrunal Thakur, and Devgn shared the release date with a new poster.

Apoorva Mukhija was forced to vacate Mumbai home after Latent row. Here's whySocial media influencer Apoorva Mukhija opened up about the time when she was forced to vacate her Mumbai apartment. She revealed that the police came to her flat with a summon after India's Got Latent controversy.

Kareena Kapoor-Saif Ali Khan leave for Delhi to attend Sunjay Kapur's funeralSunjay Kapur, Karisma Kapoor's ex-husband, will be cremated on June 19 in New Delhi. Ahead of the ceremony, Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan were spotted at Mumbai's Kalina airport as they left for the funeral.

Why Aamir Khan's films are school of perfectionism, one lesson at a timeWith the release of 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on June 20, Aamir Khan returns as Bollywood's beloved moral science teacher. His films are known for blending entertainment with meaningful life lessons.

Feeling lost and stuck: Jasmine Bhasin reflects on life after shooting for TraitorsActor Jasmine Bhasin opened up about the psychological challenges she faced during the intense 12-day shoot of the reality show 'The Traitors'. She revealed how it left her emotionally stirred and introspective.

Raj Nidimoru's wife's cryptic note on trust amid his dating rumours with SamanthaDirector Raj Nidimoru's wife, Shhyamali De, shared a cryptic note about trust on her Instagram Stories. This came amid rumours of Raj dating actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

Concentrate on the good: Kajol's advice to daughter Nysa on online trollingKajol opened up about the lessons she imparts to her daughter, Nysa Devgan, on dealing with online trolling. She shared that her advice often involves reminding Nysa that she doesn't even know if the people behind the comments are real.

Sunjay Kapur's funeral in Delhi today, Karisma and kids to pay tributeIndustrialist Sunjay Kapur died at the age of 53 during a polo match on June 12. His family has announced a prayer meeting in New Delhi on June 22.

general news.headline: Witnesses saw large pile of cash; Justice Varma filed no complaint: Inquiry panelA Supreme Court-appointed internal inquiry panel said that the unburnt and half-burnt currency at Justice Yashwant Verma's home pointed to his suspicious conduct, rejecting the judge's claim of ignorance in the case.

Nuclear sites hit, hospital bombed as Israel launches missile attack on IranIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other for the seventh consecutive day. In a live address, Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei declared that the nation remains united and will not bow to external pressure. Responding to US President Donald Trump's call for Iran to surrender, Khamenei issued a stern warning that any American military strike would lead to "serious irreparable consequences". Trump, on whether the US will attack Iran, said, "I may do it, I may not do it. I mean, nobody knows what I'm going to do." Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

For India, Canada looks friendlier than the US at this pointIndia-Canada-US ties: PM Modi's decision to subtly decline Donald Trump's invite was not only strategically significant but also emblematic of the widening trust deficit between the nations. It came as India and Canada quietly signalled a thaw in their two-year-long diplomatic freeze.

Big nuclear powers, they decided: In a first, Trump credits India-Pak for truceIn remarks hours after meeting Field Marshal Asim Munir, US President Donald Trump did not take credit for stopping the military conflict between India and Pakistan, a first.

Trump feeds General Munir as wars feed Trump's hunger for Nobel prizeThese are Trumpian times. Countries around the world are fighting among themselves to help him land the next Nobel Peace Prize. It's Trump's last term, he has all the money, he just needs a legacy.

Watch: Big explosion rocks Elon Musk's SpaceX base during Starship testingThe incident occurred just before Ship 36 was scheduled for a critical static fire test—a procedure in which the rocket's engines are ignited while the vehicle remains anchored to the ground, serving as a final systems check before launch.

Canada admits to Khalistan extremism on its soil, then accuses India of meddlingNew Delhi has long maintained that Ottawa turns a blind eye to Khalistani elements operating in Canada. The CSIS admission is a long-overdue acknowledgement of the threat.

Why no action against threats: Supreme Court to Karnataka, film body on Thug LifeThe Supreme Court criticised the Karnataka government and Film Chamber for failing to act against mobs threatening violence over the film Thug Life, affirming freedom of expression must be protected.

Insured, but at what cost?Hospitals are turning into battlegrounds over pending claims, with policyholders watching their premiums shoot up faster than their salaries. Insurance is no longer the comforting shield it once was.

Those who speak English will soon feel ashamed: Amit Shah amid language debateUnion Home Minister Amit Shah said native Indian languages were central to the country's identity and should take precedence over foreign tongues.

Video: Iranian missile strikes 1000-bed Israel hospital, patients rush to safetyIran targetted Soroka Medical Center, one of Israel's major hospitals, and populated civilian areas marks a significant escalation in tensions between the two countries.

Bunker busters, bombers, and battleships: How US is preparing for IranThe US has deployed fighter jets, warships, and troops across the Middle East to protect Israel and deter Iran, as Trump warns Tehran and considers options including strikes on nuclear sites.

Why Aamir Khan's films are school of perfectionism, one lesson at a timeWith the release of 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on June 20, Aamir Khan returns as Bollywood's beloved moral science teacher. His films are known for blending entertainment with meaningful life lessons.

Zia-Musharraf-Munir: Why the US needs Pakistan's dictatorsA 1947 British war memo shows why Pakistan, not India, suited post-imperial interests — creating a pliant state on Soviet, Iranian, and Arabian frontiers. In 2025, that logic still holds.

Supreme Court pauses Madras High Court order on top cop arrest in kidnapping caseSupreme Court set aside Madras High Court's order for arrest of Tamil Nadu ADGP HM Jayaram in connection with a kidnapping case of a minor.

Nasa confirms launch time for Indian astronaut Shubhanshu ShuklaNasa said that the change in the targeted launch date provides astronauts aboard the Space Station time to continue evaluating operations after recent repair work.

Gill's big Test: Leadership lessons from Graeme Smith's historic England tourShubman Gill will be having his toughest test as a cricketer as he officially takes over the leadership duties of the Indian Test team beginning from June 20. The Prince of Indian cricket can take a leaf out of Graeme Smith's book, who faced a similar challenge in the early days of his Test captaincy.

Karnataka plans 10-hour days for tech sector employees: ReportAt present, Section 7 of the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, 1961, limits working hours to nine per day, and allows a maximum of 10 hours of overtime in three months.

Social media influencer with 1 million followers arrested in Surat for extortionOnce a viral TikTok star, Kirti Patel was arrested in Ahmedabad after 10 months on the run in a builder extortion case. Police said she used social media to defame and pressure him.

Inside Dimona: The secretive core of Israel's nuclear powerEven as Israel keeps its own nuclear arsenal shrouded in secrecy, it is actively striking targets linked to Iran, citing Tehran's advancing nuclear research as justification. Meanwhile, satellite imagery over the past five years has revealed major construction at Israel's Dimona facility, with experts suggesting upgrades or even the possible building of a new reactor to boost plutonium production.

WatchCricketer Sachin Tendulkar watched Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' and couldn't stop raving about the power of the film. Trump privately approved attack plans for Iran but withheld final order: ReportUS President Trump approved plans to strike Iran but delayed the final order, awaiting Iran's move on its nuclear program. A military build-up is underway as tensions rise, with over 450 dead in Iran and 24 in Israel, according to reports.
Indian craftsmanship takes global stage as PM gifts unique artworks to world leadersA look at what Prime Minister Narendra Modi presented to world leaders at the G7 Summit in Canada last weekend.

Shabana Azmi recalls how Farhan Akhtar's input changed the endingShabana Azmi celebrates 25 years of the landmark film 'Fire' with co-star Nandita Das and director Deepa Mehta. She shares how Farhan Akhtar's advice changed the film's original ending, shaping its lasting legacy.

Zeenat Aman recalls her schoolgirl crush on Shashi Kapoor and that first kissActor Zeenat Aman shared her fond memories with 'Satyam Shivam Sundaram' co-actor Shashi Kapoor. From having a schoolgirl crush to sharing their first on-screen kiss, Aman praised Kapoor's warm persona and artistic legacy.

The actor shared a video in which Tendulkar could be seen giving a thumbs up to the film's team.

Neena Gupta says romance is about feeling good, not just sexVeteran actor Neena Gupta shares her thoughts on love beyond 50 and meaningful roles. She emphasises romance as feeling good rather than just physical attraction, highlighting her fearless career choices.

sports.headline: Gautam Gambhir will enjoy working with a young captain: Sanjay ManjrekarIndia tour of England: Sanjay Manjrekar believes that Gautam Gambhir will enjoy working with a young captain in Shubman Gill and expects him to bring out results as he has done with the T20I side alongside Suryakumar Yadav.

WTC 2025-27: Who will play the most Tests in new cycle?South Africa clinched the World Test Championship 2023 title with remarkable resilience. Their low number of Test matches has triggered controversy amongst cricket fans.

Test cricket aspirations? Tilak Varma signs County deal with HampshireYoung India batter Tilak Varma has signed with Hampshire for four County Championship matches. His stint coincides with India's ongoing Test series in England.

Jose Mourinho vs Turkish FA: Fenerbahce demand investigation after leaked textsTurkish club Fenerbahce has called for the investigation of the Turkish FA after the alleged leaked WhatsApp messages, which involve Jose Mourinho. It is reported that several members of the organisation have already resigned.

Al-Hilal hold Real Madrid to 1-1 draw, Man City, Juve notch winsSimone Inzaghi's Al-Hilal managed to scrape a point with a draw against Xabi Alonso's Real Madrid in the biggest upset in the Club World Cup so far. Meanwhile, both Manchester City and Juventus start off their campaign with impressive wins as well.

Ben Stokes' warning for India: England do not fear Jasprit BumrahEngland Test captain Ben Stokes has said his team does not fear India's Jasprit Bumrah. He emphasised that winning a Test series depends on the entire team, not just one bowler.

Can this Ollie Pope plan help England neutralise Jasprit Bumrah?England vice-captain Ollie Pope has outlined his strategy to tackle Jasprit Bumrah in the first Test at Headingley. His plan focusses on rotating the strike to reduce Bumrah's impact.

Mukesh Kumar's cryptic Instagram story goes viral: Karma is unforgivableIndia fast bowler Mukesh Kumar shared a cryptic Instagram post just before the start of India's 1st Test against England. His message has raised questions about his omission and team dynamics ahead of the series.

Can KL Rahul step up in absence of Virat Kohli to lead India's charge vs England?India tour of England: With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma absent, KL Rahul—now the senior-most batter in the side—finds himself as the pillar around which India's five-Test campaign in England must be built. This is his moment to step up, and with it comes the weight of expectation.

Gill's big Test: Leadership lessons from Graeme Smith's historic England tourShubman Gill will be having his toughest test as a cricketer as he officially takes over the leadership duties of the Indian Test team beginning from June 20. The Prince of Indian cricket can take a leaf out of Graeme Smith's book, who faced a similar challenge in the early days of his Test captaincy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
